info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 28 at 12:38PM EDT until March 28 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL MONTGOMERY AND CENTRAL BUCKS COUNTIES... At 1238 PM EDT, a dangerous snow squall was located over Doylestown, or 17 miles northwest of Trenton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 342 and 347. Northeast Extension between mile markers 28 and 38. Locations impacted include... Lansdale, Quakertown, Perkasie, Doylestown, Byram, Hatboro, Souderton, Bedminster, Chalfont, Hatfield, New Hope, Dublin, Bryn Athyn, Ivyland, Stockton, Fricks, Willow Grove, Pipersville, Gardenville and Richboro. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
